definition: lit. much thunder but little rain; fig. a lot of talk but little action/his bark is worse than his bite
surname Lei
thunder/mine (weapon)/(Internet slang) terrifying/terrific
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
rain/CL:陣|阵[zhen4],場|场[chang2]
to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet
small/tiny/few/young
lit. see the wind and assume it will rain (idiom); fig. gullible/to believe whatever people suggest
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
superficial show/going through the motions
short-sighted/limited vision
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
to cut one's flesh to cover a sore (idiom); faced with a current crisis, to make it worse by a temporary expedient
short-sighted
to stir up trouble at every opportunity (idiom)
lit. a single post cannot prop up a falling house (idiom)/fig. one is helpless alone
officialese/official routine/(old) (conventional phrase used in response to one's superior) in view of the above, we therefore...
person narrow-minded and shortsighted
lit. to foster an ulcer and bequeath a calamity (idiom); tolerating budding evil can only lead to disaster/to cherish a viper in one's bosom
to sit and await success or failure (idiom); to wait to see the outcome of a fight before taking sides/to sit on the fence
cow and famous steed at the same trough (idiom); fig. the common and the great are treated alike
to make frequent or unpredictable changes in policy (idiom)
lit. cutting one's stomach to hide a pearl (idiom)/fig. wasting a lot of effort on trivialities
